Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent Piperacillin (2-128 μg/mL) - Gram-Negative ID/AST or AST only Phoenix panels
Regulation Name(s): Antimicrobial Susceptibility Test System Short Incubation
Specimen Type(s): Isolates from pure culture of Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System using Piperacillin for automated susceptibility testing of Gram-negative organisms
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by minimal inhibitory concentration of most Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria isolates, and Gram-positive bacteria isolates from pure culture using Piperacillin (2-128 μg/mL), including removal of limitations for Proteus mirabilis, Providencia species, and Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
